intro: Cephaelis paraensis, commonly known as the Paraensis Cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found growing along stream banks or in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
